fields.description:
I currently went through the process of upgrading the bamboo plugin from plugins 1 to plugins 2 when i hit an interesting problem.

1) Your plugin can not contain any classes in packages that also exist in jira
2) Our plugin put all action classes inside com.atlassian.jira.web.action to make use of the automatic class resolution.

The solution is to move your action classes to a plugin specific directory and explicitly define the full class name in your atlassian-plugin.xml e.g

{code}
<webwork1 key="bambooServerConfig" name="Configure Your Bamboo Server">
        <actions>
            <action name="com.atlassian.jira.plugin.ext.bamboo.web.ViewBambooServers" alias="ViewBambooServers">
                <view name="success">/templates/plugins/bamboo/viewServers.vm</view>
            </action>
        </actions>
    </webwork1>
{code}

It would be great if this could get documented somewhere.
fields.summary: Plugin 2 documentation should mention issues with webwork modules.

fields.description:
When unfavouriting a dashboard with name '<script>alert('blah');</script>' the javascript is executed.

fields.description:
# Go to config mode of the 'Issue Statistics' gadget
# Choose a project -- the 'No Filter/Project selected' text is replaced by the name of the project.
# Click save -- the gadget correctly uses the selected project
# Click configure -- the 'No Filter/Project selected' shows, not the name of the selected project, even though the property *has* been saved
fields.summary: The project/filter picker doesn't show the chosen project when you return to a gadgets config view

fields.description:
Steps to reproduce:
* log into jira, create a new filter and share the filter with everyone
* add browse-project permission to the 'anyone' group for a project
* log into refapp as admin
* add a JIRA gadget (such as resolution time gadget or pie-chart gadget) to refapp's dashboard
* DO NOT click the lock button to do an oauth approval
* config the gadget to use the previously created filter/project
* you should see the gadget render something (with the oauth icon shown unlocked)
* log out of refapp
* you now see the gadget is blank
* click on the config icon
* type in the filter/project field, autocompletion does not come up with a suggestion
fields.summary: Gadgets show up blank when accessed anonymously from refapp without logging into refapp
Various warnings in logs to investigate

fields.description:
The current released plugin base (jira-plugin-base-15.pom) only supports up to JIRA version 3.13.2.  There are some bug fixes in the latest release of JIRA 3.13.X that I require for my plugins to function correctly.  It would be helpful to get a new release of the jira-plugin-base that supports this release of JIRA for the testing data and libraries.

To clarify, I understand that the plugins developed on this version of jira-plugin-base can be used on 3.13.5... what I am looking for is the plugin-base to support 3.13.5 test data, and use JIRA 3.13.5 for integration testing.
fields.summary: Need a new release of the jira-plugin-base to support JIRA 3.13.5 for integration testing

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-18349].
  {panel}

    *  The list is very long, its hard to find the columns you are after (it took me a while just to find the issue key column), perhaps you could add a few key ones at the top of the list as well (e.g Key and Name).
    * There is no horizontal ordering available, it only does it alphabetically, so there is no way to achieve "the default plus one extra column". This could be helped by just ensuring that if they select the issue key, it will get put on the leftmost column no matter what.
    * Gadget width was an interesting hurdle. I added a bunch of columns and they just got hidden off the side in such a way that i didn't even realise that there was more to see. Maybe a scroll bar or something to provide a visual indication that there is more data off to the side.
    * Is there somewhere where you can change your personal gadget defaults - set columns, horizontal ordering and sorting?? Something like this would be cool, it would mean I didn't have to pick all the columns every time I created a gadget (and would overcome most of my previous points).

https://extranet.atlassian.com/display/QA/Brydie%27s+Findings

Some of our customer perform evaluation of our product against MS SQL Express. 

Unfortunately, we don't have any instruction for them, but our [MS SQL page|http://www.atlassian.com/software/jira/docs/latest/databases/sqlserver.html], which doesn't seem to be sufficient enough.

We could create a note on the above mentioned page with a link to a third-party blog post - http://thesnowdrift.spaces.live.com/Blog/cns!8D8061E0A7212946!193.entry or create our own version of the instruction.

fields.description:
{noformat}
Error: $(this).find is not a function
Source File: http://jira.atlassian.com/s/432/1/1.0/_/download/batch/jira.webresources:header/jira.webresources:header.js
Line: 1
{noformat}

This is _just_ happened today, so it may be related to Jed's velocity caching. Things that don't work any more:
# Create issue
# Go to other screen prevention

This seems to only occur for certain issue screens. e.g. it is a problem on when on http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/BAM-4240 but not a problem on this page http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRA-18335

fields.description:
When there is an OAuthProtocolException, such as when the consumer key is unknown, the gadget view is just blank, with nothing to inform the user what's wrong.  We should handle this better.

From: https://studio.atlassian.com/browse/AG-924
fields.summary: Need to handle OAuth errors better in the gadget framework

fields.description:
(1)When user's go to edit their general preferences, they should be able to configure how many history they want set. 

(2)They should be a separate html page or tab for history, not a sleezy pop-up, so any user can track their previously viewed SCR over weeks, dates or months. This reduces search time. Plus the system will be able to gather some metrics on this, if needed

Bottom, line...The above changes are not very needed, but what is evident here is that the 'history capability' at the moment sucks and It would be nice to see more and something that can stay even if I log out and exit my session, in case I want to see what i did yesterday.
fields.summary: 'History' capabilities need improvement

fields.description: Typing wiki text at times can be a pain. It will be nice to have a wiki editor that can speed up the process
fields.summary: need for wiki text editor for JIRA

fields.description:
Using the SOAP interface, you can corrupt the database using the editIssue and changing the issueType field to another issueType using a different workflow. I discovered that problem excepting JIRA To refuse the edit like the web interface would do. 

Steps to reproduce:
 - create issue TEST-1 with type A (workflow A, status open).
 - progress the workflow on issue TEST-1 with SOAP (type A, workflow A, status "new_status" ).
 - edit issue TEST-1 and set issueType to type B (which uses a different workflow that type A). Not that the workflow of issueType B does *not* support the status "new_status".

the SOAP call will actually work and put the status in a very bad situation. Using the web interface and loading the issue TEST-1, you can see that the issue kept the status "new_status" but can no longer perform any workflow operation. The Integrity checker will confirm that with the error:
{noformat}
  Check workflow current step entries
   UNFIXABLE ERROR: 	The issue with key XXXTEST-1294 has a status of Ship Requested which is not a valid status for the issues workflow, contact Atlassian support to resolve this problem. 
{noformat}

checking on the web interface and performing the same steps, the edit page will not allow me to change the issueType with the following message:
{noformat}
There are no issue types with compatible field configuration and/or workflow associations.
The issue type can only be changed by moving this issue. 
{noformat}

and I would have to move it.
fields.summary: SOAP edit issue type can corrupt database

fields.summary: NullPointerException when releasing a version with issues

fields.description:
In the configuration of a gadget that uses autocomplete(e.g. Average Age Chart Gadget -> Project or Saved Filter field), type a few letters to bring up autocomplete options.
Instead of pressing enter, press tab. The autocomplete does not disappear.
Now shift+tab back to the select field with autocomplete. The autocomplete should now disappear and it will seem as if the option was selected but if you save your preferences, you will get an "An internal server error occurred when requesting resource" error.
fields.summary: Tabbing in gadget configuration with autocomplete
"Login & approve" button does not go away after approval for bugzilla gadget

fields.description:
When oauth tokens expires, the gadget displays a "Login & approve" button.
Clicking on the button may result in "file not found" [JRA-18322].
Sometimes, the link actually works, but after approving the oauth request, the "Login & approve" button stays put.
Currently, the only way to acquire a new oauth token is to refresh the dashboard.
The gadget should handle the token expiration nicely and acquire a new token.
fields.summary: "Login & approve" button should acquire new oauth token when the old one expires

fields.description:

oauth_problem=token_expired

fields.description:
Steps:
1. Setup a JIRA instance with localhost:8090 base URL.
2. I am able to access JIRA instance on other machine using http://vbharara:8090/.
3. On the same machine if I try logging using http://vbharara:8090/ it works fine.
4. Try to some other machine.

Result:
1. It doesn't work and give message that user id/pwd is wrong.
2. Updated the Base URL to vbharara:8090 and everything start working.

Expected:
1. Login gadget should work without any issues.
fields.summary: Login gadget doesn't work if baseURL is localhost and trying to access JIRA with machine name.

fields.description:
The WorkflowTransitionUtilImpl calls getRemoteUser() to authenticate if the currently logged in user can leave comments.  This seems illogical however as it is possible to specify the username to be used for the workflow transition.  Any comments left will be left using the specified username, not the currently logged in user.

As the functionality currently stands, the context's remote user must be overridden with the username, prior to attempting to validate the workflow transition or execute it.  This seems redundant when the name is specified already for the transition.
fields.summary: WorkflowTransitionUtilImpl incorrectly calls getRemoteUser() for authentication of comments

fields.description:
Steps:
1. Login to JIRA
2. Add gadget "Assigned to me " to the dashboard.
3. Click "Save" to save the settings of the gadget.

Result:
1. The gadget get displayed with long frame and lots of empty space in bottom.
2. It works fine in other browsers.

Expected:
1. The gadget should get resize and occupy the required space.
fields.summary: Assigned to me gadget doesn't get resize after saving preferences in Safari 3 & 4

fields.description:
The docs at http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA/Advanced+Searching?clicked=jirahelp#AdvancedSearching-Created say 

{quote}
Use the date format that has been set by your JIRA administrator
{quote}

This isn't actually the case. JQL uses a set of hard coded formats to verify against and only those are accepted. Right now the list is:

yyyy/MM/dd HH:mm
yyyy-MM-dd HH:mm
yyyy/MM/dd
yyyy-MM-dd

We should probably have some example queries to show what we mean by these.

All of the date related fields will need to have their explanation changed.
fields.summary: docs on JQL date formats is incorrect

fields.description: When non-favourited dashboard is selected, the dashboard dropdown shows no bolded dashboard. Session is not kept of the previous favourited dashboard. If dashboard home is clicked, the first dashboard is selected.
fields.summary: If nonfavourited dashboard selected, dashboard session is empty

fields.description:
I'm doing some (significant) plugin work a our company (we do have an enterprise edition) to provide more functionality between linked issues.  One of the key hassles I am facing however is that at current, there is no way to create a listener that can detect changes to an issue's linked status.  

Tracing through the JIRA source, it appears that this function is being deliberately muted as com.atlassian.jira.issue.link.DefaultIssueLinkManager.createChangeItem(GenericValue, ChangeItemBean, User) deliberately sets the created IssueUpdateBean.dispatchEvent to false.

Unfortunately, doing this means that I need to manually detect changes in the linking status... a rather painful operation as I then need an extra service, which polls the links manager and attempts to find any changes.  I researched, but was unable to find the reason for this IssueUpdateBean being muted.

This is partially a request, partially a query... why has this functionality been implemented this way?  Is there a better way than what I am doing (I really do hope so)... and are there any intentions to change this?
fields.summary: Issue link creation should fire an issue updated event

fields.description:
We should change the simple issue navigator to show a project input control when there is only one project in the system.

This controller should have the All suggestion but should default to the one existing project as the selected project.

Once this is in place we should remove the check in the "doesItFit" code so that when there is one project in the system and someone has created a query WITHOUT the project we should still be able to switch to the simple navigator. In this case it will be that the All option in the project selector will be the chosen selection.

We should only pre-select the project in the input control when they are creating a new search.

This will require fixing some func tests I am sure.
fields.summary: We should change the simple issue navigator to show a project input control when there is only one project in the system

fields.description:
When editing a subscription filter, the pane showing the current filter is not updated, leading to the user to think they're updating 1 filter while they're actually updating another.

Steps to reproduce:
Create multiple filters, and set up a subscription to one of them
Go to the Manage Filters page
Select the filter without a subscription
The filter description and criteria are displayed in the left pane, the results in the right
Click on Manage
The left pane remains the same, but the right pane shows the available filters.
In the right pane, click on the "n Subscriptions" link for the other filter that was set up with at least one subscription. The left pane remains showing the old filter name while the right pane shows the new filter name. It's very confusing, and a screenshot is attached.
fields.summary: Incorrect filter shown when editing or adding subscription
Add ability to sort "Time Tracking" report by additional fields....
Update ajs.gadget framework with changes from Bamboo

fields.description:
The tools dropdown on the issuenavigator on JAC is empty for logged out users.  There's actually no actions to be displayed to logged out users, so the whole 'Tools' dropdown should be hidden.

Currently header.jsp (for the issuenavigator) is implemented quite badly.  It has a lot of 'if' statements in the JSP to determine what dropdown items to show.  This makes it hard to hide the whole dropdown if there's no items, and to determine the last time (to apply class="last").

I think this should be changed such that the web-action returns a List of items/groups and all the relevant checks for the times are done in the web-action.  Then in the JSP we simply iterate over the items (if there's none, we hide the whole dropdown) and apply class="last" to the last item.
fields.summary: Tools dropdown empty for anonymous users in the issue navigator

In order for JIRA to work under Java 1.4, we used to include the xerces jar under common/endorsed.
However, this is now out of date, and we don't support Java 1.4 any more.
We need to remove these files in order for some plugins to work correctly.

fields.description:
After signing up to a JIRA instance, I got an email which simply amazed me - it contained:

* My username
* My email address
* My full name
* My password

It was all there, right before me, in a plain-text unencrypted email sent across a public network. WTF?!

I'm not sure which universe that's considered a good idea in, but the one I live in considers providing all that info in a plain text email an EPIC FAIL.

A sign-up email should, at most, contain a brief 'welcome to our issue tracker' message and a link to the issue tracker home page. AND NOTHING ELSE.

If I forget my username or password, I can go to the site and retrieve them. Emailing me all those details 'just in case I forget' (assuming I keep that email in my inbox) is utterly, utterly insane and deeply wrong on more levels than I can count on a millipedes' legs.

Why on earth would you put the username, email and password in to a plain text email?! Just retarded. Not only does it cater to all the desires of a man-in-the-middle attack, there must also be gazillions of such emails sitting in people's email inboxes, just waiting for hackers to come in and take them.

Please fix this epic fail and provide patches for earlier versions of JIRA.

Once again, in case I didn't get this point across:

h1. EPIC. FAIL.
fields.summary: EPIC FAIL: new user signups result in plain text email with all login details

fields.description:
Even though having logged in as "admin" to refapp and done the oauth approval, the gadget still says:
You must be an Administrator to view this gadget.
fields.summary: Admin gadget does not detect user's role correctly when deployed on a refapp dashboard

fields.description:
If trusted app relationship is established between JIRA and refapp, the gadgets should work without the need to ask for approval.

Currently, this is not happening. And when trusted app is established as well as refapp added to JIRA's oauth consumer list, the gadget works by doing an oauth approval.
fields.summary: JIRA gadgets does not work in refapp if trusted app relationship is established without adding refapp to JIRA's oauth consumer list

fields.description:
Create a dataset with custom resolutions: {{unresolved}}, and {{"unresolved"}}.

In JQL, begin to type: {{resolution = "}}

At this point you are presented with all suggestions, which is okay because you're opening a string.
If you type another quote {{"}}, you still see all suggestions, because you closed the string.
If you type a third quote {{"}}, you now only see the two custom resolutions as suggestions.
If you type a fourth quote {{"}}, only the quoted unresolved suggestion remains.

This seems a little strange. The unquoted unresolved value, which actually needs to be displayed in autocomplete with quotes, shouldn't match 3 quotes? Neither should the quoted unresolved value match 4 quotes.
fields.summary: Autocomplete handles typing of quotes interestingly

fields.description:
Steps:
1. Login to JIRA.
2. Add any JIRA gadget in the dashboard.
3. Type some char to find filters in quick search. ex..all
4. User get the list of option matching the characters.
5. Select the project/filter.

Result:
1. The quicksearch textbox still contain text all and not actual project/filter name.

Expected:
1. The text field should have project/filter name.
fields.summary: For JIRA gadgets, selecting filter from quick search doesn't set the text field with the selected filter name

fields.description:
Both assigned-to-me gadget and in-progress gadget allows user to select multiple columns to display.
It works if the gadget is deployed on a JIRA dashboard.
But it doesn't work when it is deployed on a refapp dashboard AND MULTIPLE options are selected: submitting the config does not render the gadget view, nor does it come back with any error message.
And once you've selected multiple options, even if you now select a single option, it still does not work.
It is the same for "Projects" gadget, which allows user to select multiple projects.
fields.summary: Multi-select gadget config field does not work when JIRA gadget is deployed on refapp dashboard

fields.description: The create issue dialog doesn't work when projects don't have an avatar.  The server throws a 500.
fields.summary: Create issue dialog should handle projects with no avatars

fields.description:
Steps:
1. Login to JIRA.
2. Add average age chart gadget to Dashboard.

Result:
1. The gadget keep on showing progress bar but nothing happens.

Expected:
1. User should be able to add the gadget and use it.
fields.summary: Average age chart is not working in IE 6.0

fields.description: Add a content tag to the page that the header tag will pick up an select that tag.
fields.summary: Add selected/current tab to header

fields.description:
In pie chart gadget, the button and the help text are displayed in a box on the top of the view (see oauth-good.png).
In voted issues gadget, only the button is displayed and the config fields are hidden (see oauth-ok.png).
In favourite filters gadget, only the button is displayed but it's mixed with the config fields in an ugly way (see oauth-bad.png).
fields.summary: The appearance of "Login & approve" button and related help text is inconsistent

fields.description: This results in road map gadget not usable at all when added to dashboard of other applications.
fields.summary: "Login & approve" button does not go away after approval for road map gadget

fields.description: When adding a JIRA gadget to the refapp dashboard (started by atlassian-gadgets), the config view is displayed without the "Login & approve" button, if the config view does not require sending a request to JIRA. However, when the config is submitted or an autocomplete field triggers an Ajax request to JIRA, the "Login & approve" button is displayed. All previous input will be lost after the oauth processing.
fields.summary: "Login & approve" button should be displayed for JIRA gadgets that has a config view, without requiring to make a request to JIRA

fields.description:
Steps:
1. Login to JIRA
2. Open any dashboard and try adding "Issue Statistics" gadget from directory.

Result:
1. It keep on showing you progress bar.
2. The gadget is working fine on Firefox windows/mac and safari 3.0

Expected:
1. The gadget should get add without any issue
fields.summary: Issue statistics gadget is not working on IE 8.0
include an interesting example in the JQL screenshot

fields.description:
Steps:
1. Login to JIRA and create a new dashboard.
2. Change the layout to one column layout.
3. Add gadgets like "Average age chart", "Created vs resolved","Recently created chart" and "Time since chart".
4. Configure the gadgets and save it.

Result.
1. One gadget approx takes whole screen of user and make user scroll to see others.
2. This is on resolution 1900*1200, think about lower ones.
3. Viewing these gadget in other layout is better.

Expected:
1. As we support canvas mode for all these gadgets, we can do with a smaller size.
2. User experience should be better.
fields.summary: Charts gadgets in JIRA occupy a huge screen space when viewed in one column layout in dashboard.

fields.description:
On the first step of create issue, we should put an inline-dialog on the quick create link.  This will teach the users to click it.

Must be dismissible and state remembered in a cookie.
fields.summary: Create a "Did you know" for the create issue page

fields.description: We should lock up JIRA with a JohnsonEvent if there's a problem loading up the plugin system (i.e. an OSGiContainerException).  This could be the case if an older version of OSGi interfers with our version in Websphere, or if you startup JIRA on Tomcat with a JDK1.4 compatibility pack installed (which puts an old incompatible version of xerces on the classpath).
fields.summary: Lockup JIRA on startup if there's an OSGiContainerExceptions being thrown

fields.description: Probably no way around this, but worth investigating.  At the very least we should update requirements in our docs.
fields.summary: Charts require X Server to be installed for AWT rendering

fields.description:
The official JIRA documentation for MySQL as referenced from http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA/Recommended+Databases states "This document applies to MySQL 3.53.x up to 5.0.x.".
See this comment: http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA/Setting+up+JIRA+Standalone+and+MySQL+on+Linux?focusedCommentId=198806483#comment-198806483

#1. I trust then that this would work with the latest 5.0.x releases (5.0.84 community release or the latest 5.0.x enterprise release)?

#2. No mention is made of 5.1.x?  Is this officially supported?  I need the official word before we move ahead.

#3. No mention is made of the preferred engine_type in the official documentation.  One of the previous user posts recommends using InnoDB and states that "MyISAM does not support transactions and will cause corrupt workflows on errors".  What is the official recommendation?

#4. No mention is made of the preferred setting for the SQL_MODE variable?  It would depend on how JIRA as an application would handle the input of invalid or missing data, but to allow for behavior that is similar to Oracle or DB2, should STRICT checking be enforced or should SQL_MODE be left blank?  Here is an example setting for SQL_MODE from one of my other MySQL servers:
SQL_MODE='STRICT_TRANS_TABLES, STRICT_ALL_TABLES, NO_ZERO_IN_DATE, NO_ZERO_DATE, ERROR_FOR_DIVISION_BY_ZERO, NO_AUTO_CREATE_USER, IGNORE_SPACE, ANSI_QUOTES, PIPES_AS_CONCAT, ONLY_FULL_GROUP_BY'
fields.summary: MySQL supported version and installation questions

fields.description:
See screenshots. On Firefox it looks OK. On IE it is hardly clear what the user is supposed to do.

To reproduce, browse the JRA project and click on the Create Issue operation. Curiously, even though I am browsing the JIRA project, the default project is still "A Test Project" as can be seen from the screenshots. Maybe you want to track that as a separate bug.
fields.summary: Create issue interface doesn't work as expected in I.E. 6
